result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrell Lamont Otis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges to apply for work.

miscConds.notes:
No violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
No use or possession of firearms.
Follow through with any programs or assessments recommended by the Agent.
Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample.
Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darrell Lamont Otis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darrell Lamont Otis in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Darrell Lamont Otis.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 0 DAYS time served. Huber privileges to apply for work.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
- No violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
- Follow through with any programs or assessments recommended by the Agent.
- No use or possession of firearms. 
- Seek and Maintain full-time employment.
- AODA assessment and treatment.

- Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample
- Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN

Defendant Darrell Lamont Otis in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Reserve Branch 13.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Darrell Lamont Otis in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski for Haley E Wentz.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Darrell Lamont Otis appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Darrell Lamont Otis in court.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/14/2022 @1:30p
